data.shownotes: The band headlined the O’Donnell Gardens Stage. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist may be incomplete. Songs footnoted as "first reported performance" are based on reports from attendees and reports of a hand-written setlist (photo unavailable) with working titles for the songs played (Bit, Math, Bit, Hip Hop, 3/4, Angel and Ghost). Seperately, Stu confirmed they debuted Satan Speeds Up at this show during the June 8, 2023 early show. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist may be incomplete. The songs listed were reported by an attendee. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.
data.opener: Chris Russell's Chicken Walk, Kinloch Troons

data.shownotes: I’m In Your Mind contained alternate lyrics. Before The Wholly Ghost, Stu asks Joey if they should play Angel next which was the working title for Her and I (Slow Jam 2) and Joey says they should play Ghost instead the working title for The Wholly Ghost. Before Her and I, Stu asks the crowd "Do you mind if we play a chilled out jammy one or is that boring?".  This is the earliest recording available for the song, which strongly resembles the studio version, although they are still working out the jam sections.  After, Stu asks if they can keep playing new stuff because "they need practice".  Following Am I in Heaven?, Stu shouts out the opener, Ice Balloons, and gives them a "big extra thank you" for letting them borrow their equipment.
data.opener: Blackstone Rngrs, Ice Balloons, Christmas Pets

data.shownotes: KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is likely complete. Most of the songs were confirmed by the attached review and the rest were confirmed by attendees. If anyone has any information on what else was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show was an acoustic performance by Stu and Joey on Triple R. KGLW.net Staff Notes: This performance is believed to be complete. A recording exists of the Her and I (Slow Jam 2) / Slow Jam 1 performance as well as an interview, but no setlist exists to confirm if more was played. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

data.showtitle: Panache CMJ Day Party & Hangover Brunch
data.shownotes: Stripped down set played by Stu, Joey, and Cavs. This show featured the debut of Stressin'. Following Her and I (Slow Jam 2), Joey mentioned that it was "too early for jazz", to which Cavs briefly teased The River. During It's Got Old, Ambrose played harmonica from the audience. Vegemite was announced as a song about Australia's national dish. During God is Calling Me Back Home, which was played for the first time known since 2013-12-31 (73 show gap), Stu was brought a piece of cake by Tim Presley from White Fence and Cate Le Bond, which Eric and the band's manager Michelle Cable then fed to Stu. “Happy Birthday to You” was sung to Stu at the end of the set.
data.tourname: 2014 I'm In Your Mind Fuzz - North America

data.shownotes: Am I In Heaven? contained Cellophane and Head On/Pill teases KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. All songs were confirmed by photo/video. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Her and I was confirmed by audio/video and the rest were reported by an attendee. If anyone has any information on what else was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Her and I (Slow Jam 2) was played for the first time known since 2015-09-03. (351 show gap) KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Planet B, Her and I (Slow Jam 2) and Self-Immolate were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Gamma Knife, Her and I (Slow Jam 2) and Planet B were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This was the first 3 hour marathon-like concert, performed for fundraising and awareness of recent Australian bushfires, and the last concert performed with drummer Eric Moore. Evil Star intro song played from house speakers before the show. I'm Not in Your Mind contained a Cellophane tease. Cellophane contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Wah Wah contained The River teases and quotes. Willoughby's Beach was played for the first time known since 2016-06-25. (280 shows) Sea of Trees was played for the first time since 2017-04-02 (214 shows) and contained Head On/Pill teases. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. Superbug was dedicated to the Coronavirus.

data.jamchart_notes: The first acoustic rendition of Her and I is quite strong, as the jam moves into a rather dark and jazzy jam, with great piano contributions from Ambrose. The band explores this moody space for a few minutes before returning to the song via a rambunctious harmonica solo. The end moves back into that darker mode, before building back up as Stu repeatedly says “Bye bye” to the crowd while simultaneously being unable to stop jamming. A appropriate closer to a fantastic and groundbreaking show.
data.shownotes: This show was a fully acoustic warmup gig for acoustic night of the Princess Theatre residency and featured the debut of Most of What I Like. It's Got Old was played for the first time since 2015-09-13. (354 show gap) Sleepwalker was played for the first time since 2016-02-28. (325 show gap) Most Of What I Like contained “Praise You” (Fatboy Slim) teases. The intro to Sense contained “Come On” (The Notorious B.I.G.) quotes. Prior to Slow Jam 1 opening band The Bush was shouted out and mention was made that Ambrose's sister Edith is in the band. The song itself contained a Her and I (Slow Jam 2) tease.

This was the Acoustic Night show of the Princess Theatre residency, the first of five planned shows, each featuring a different specific genre and preannounced songs. The Bitter Boogie was dedicated to “the last two years.” Most Of What I Like contained Praise You (Fatboy Slim) teases. Her and I contained Slow Jam 1 quotes. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in Brisbane '21. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

This was a fully acoustic show, the first one performed by the band outside of Australia. The River contained Wah Wah teases. Muddy Water featured Ambrose on sax. Cookie and Ambrose played on the same piano during Mr. Beat. Blame It On The Weather was introduced by Ambrose as a song about the weather in Melbourne, as well as being introduced as a song about Ambrose's dog by Stu. In the intro to The Bitter Boogie, which also featured Ambrose on sax, Joey says that the show is a "beta test" and asks if any of the crowd are going to Coachella, which the band played two days later. Dirt and Hot Water featured Mildlife guitarist Adam Halliwell on flute. Most Of What I Like also featured Ambrose on sax. The solo in Let Me Mend The Past was ommitted. Her and I featured Mildlife drummer Jim Rindfleish on congas and contained a Sleepwalker quote and tease and Crumbling Castle teases. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings exist. All songs listed were confirmed through audio/video recordings, however The River through Muddy Water and Most Of What I Like are only partially available so any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Nuclear Fusion was dedicated to Skrillex. Stu did the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion at Joey’s request. SPELLLING and Amyl and the Sniffers were shouted out after Plastic Boogie. Her and I contained Iron Lung quotes and Slow Jam 1 quotes. Evil Death Roll contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Boogieman Sam was dedicated to Belgium (home of sound tech Gaspard Demulemeester) and contained Cut Throat Boogie quotes. Amby introduced The Dripping Tap as a song about his water bill.
data.venuename: Event Lawn at Virgin Hotels Las Vegas

data.jamchart_notes: Longest live version of this track to date.
data.shownotes: Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases.  Gamma Knife contained People-Vultures teases. Self-Immolate featured a drum solo by Cavs.  Her and I contained an Am I In Heaven? tease, Iron Lung quotes/teases, Slow Jam 1 quotes, Ice V teases and The River teases.

This show featured the debut of both Presumptuous and The Grim Reaper. Her and I contained an Am I In Heaven? intro, Presumptuous quotes, and an Iron Lung jam with lyrics. Presumptuous was introduced as being "like what Santana sounds like in 2022." Sea of Trees contained alternate lyrics ("ignore it" instead of "unfold") and The Dripping Tap and Head On/Pill teases. Hot Water contained Shanghai teases. The Grim Reaper was introduced as a song about a time Ambrose's neighbor believed that devils were chasing her.

Her and I contained Hell's Itch teases.  After The Fourth Colour, Joey asks the crowd to “take a step back”. The Grim Reaper contained Sadie Sorceress quotes. Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were performed with Leah Senior providing the narration. Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were played for the first time since 2019-10-08 (96 show gap). Evil Death Roll contained Alter Me teases, Hell's Itch teases and a Hypertension Jam, which would debut properly the following night.

Poster By Arash Zarifian
Standard 250 / 30 Foil Prints

data.jamchart_notes: A calm start leads into a diabolical jam much heavier than other 2022 performance. After slowing into another calm chorus, the band speeds up before Ambrose kicks it into high gear.
data.shownotes: Vomit Coffin featured the now-infamous “Amby Snot Rocket”. Blame It on the Weather was humorously announced as the “complete opposite style of music” to the show-opening Murder of the Universe suite. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Cut Throat Boogie was announced as a song about Ambrose getting stabbed in the neck with a broken bottle. Wah Wah began with the intro to The River and subsequently featured The River quotes and teases, as well as a jam. Sadie Sorceress featured an additional verse from The Grim Reaper played over the music to Sadie Sorceress. Joey requested the cameraperson zoom in to his face as close as possible during the intro to Self-Immolate and introduced Cavs as “John Henry Bonham”, followed by a drum solo and a “Moby Dick” (Led Zeppelin) tease, plus an additional brief drum solo and “Moby Dick” tease at the end of the song. Before Her and I (Slow Jam 2), the weather was discussed and the band’s ignorance regarding Fahrenheit to Celsius conversions was revealed. The song itself featured a Flamethrower jam, Slow Jam 1 and Magma teases, and a brief Cut Throat Boogie jam. Hot Wax was dedicated to one of the band's sound engineers, Joe Santarpia. Timeland was played over the PA as the setbreak music. Head On/Pill opened with “The Star-Spangled Banner” intro, contained Hypertension teases and a Witchcraft tease, and was unfinished leading into Am I in Heaven?. Venusian 1 closed with a Cavs drum solo which led into Venusian 2. Ambrose introduced Billabong Valley as being about a bushranger and is interrupted by Joey calling him “mad-cunt Morgan”. Let Me Mend The Past, which contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote, was announced as a song about Ambrose’s somewhat troubled upbringing and was dedicated to Edith, Ambrose’s sister. Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were performed with Leah Senior providing the narration. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Tetrachromacy and Hypertension were on the printed setlist but cut due to time constraints. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live at Red Rocks ‘22. Poster By Jason Galea Second Edition of Poster

Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases. Her & I (Slow Jam 2) contained Iron Lung quotes and teases. This Thing was played for the first time since Feb. 21, 2020 (94 show gap) and contained The Dripping Tap quotes. Before Magenta Mountain, Stu announced that he was a “dickhead." Joey subsequently changed the lyrics of Magenta Mountain to “I don’t believe Stu”. Robot Stop contained Hot Water and Her & I (Slow Jam 2) teases. During Hot Water Stu took over drums & Cavs crowd surfed. Shanghai, Trapdoor and Evil Death Roll were on the printed setlist but were not played. Poster By Drew Millward

This was a fully acoustic show (except for the electric bass), the fourth such show in the band’s history ( December 13, 2021, December 19, 2021, April 13, 2022). Scheduled opening band Kamikaze Palm Tree’s set was cancelled due to an inclement weather warning. Lonely Steel Sheet Flyer was played for the first time since May 8, 2022 (81 show gap). Muddy Water featured Amby on sax. The River (#1) contained Wah Wah teases. Wah Wah was unfinished. The River (#2) contained Wah Wah and Ice V teases. Amby dedicated Let Me Mend The Past, which contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote, to his father, Broderick Smith, who passed away recently. Following The Bitter Boogie, the band teased “Stairway to Heaven” (Led Zeppelin) and improvised a short bluegrass tune. Following The Wheel Stu briefly left the stage; while awaiting his return Joey quoted Superbad, stating he felt like Steven Glansburg and then teased “Taylor” (Jack Johnson), Amby quoted “Beyond the Sea” (Bobby Darin) and Joey teased and quoted “Are You Gonna Be My Girl” (Jet). Presumptuous featured Stu going around to every band member and giving them a sip of champagne, as well as spraying champagne on the crowd. Most Of What I Like was played for the first time since June 1, 2022 (70 show gap) and was dedicated by Joey to his partner Edith (Amby’s sister), had Stu and Amby sitting on piano together, and contained “Praise You” (Fatboy Slim) quotes/teases. Her and I contained teases of Am I In Heaven?, “España cañí” (Pascual Marquina Narro) and Blindness (The Fall). Slow Jam 1 and Sense were on the written setlist as the final 2 songs but were not played. KGLW.net Staff Notes: Fans of stage banter should check out this show, as the band, especially Stu, was in a talkative mood. Discussions included the band’s ability to chill hard, how acoustic nights are like days off for Cavs to drink, and even theorizing why Stu might be more talkative tonight. Poster By Jason Galea 485 Standard / 150 Foil Prints

Anoxia was played for the first time since October 18, 2022 (52 show gap). Her and I contained Magenta Mountain and Blindness (The Fall) teases. After the song, Ambrose quotes Walk The Dinosaur (Was (Not Was)). Evil Death Roll contained Witchcraft and Converge teases. Wah Wah contained The River quotes. Only Parts I, II, and III of The River were performer and they contained Her and I (Slow Jam 2), Am I In Heaven?, and Hell's Itch teases. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam. Poster By Jason Galea 420 Standard / 120 Foil

Before Theia, Ambrose quoted Fried. The song itself contained Motor Spirit quotes, a The River jam with Wah Wah quotes, and Motor Spirit and The Silver Cord jams with lyrics. Joey did Michael Jackson-style vocal improv in the intro to Ambergris, which was introduced as a song about sperm whales and contained a short drum solo. Joey did an impression of Guy Fieri before Rats In The Sky. Cavs teased Rock and Roll (Led Zeppelin) before Sad Pilot. After Rats in the Sky, the band heckled Jason Galea to join on tambourine. Before Flight b741, the band got Cavs to hit the gong on his kit. After Flight b741, the band explained that Geelong, aka G-troit, is the sister city to Detroit, as both had a Ford production factory, which closed and destroyed the town. Joey teased Purple Haze (Jimi Hendrix) and Cavs teased Rock and Roll again. You Can Be Your Silhouette contained an extended intro where the band talked about how their talkback mics work and jazz notes. During the song itself, which contained a The End (The Doors) quote, it was described as a song about being yourself. During the intro to Straws In The Wind, the band joked about Ambrose swimming over to Canada and Ambrose walked up to the lights and sound booth.  Nuclear Fusion featured Vincent, a kid from the audience on the intro. Following the intro, Joey teased Twist (Korn). After Nuclear Fusion, Stu shouted out the stream crew. Honey contained O.N.E teases. Minimum Brain Size was introduced as a song about "loser hypermasculine people."  Prior to Rattlesnake Joey conducted a Q&A session with crowd members and Sam. Prior to Billabong Valley, Cavs ran offstage. During Billabong Valley, Joey said he can do a Limp Bizkit beat cause he doesn’t have an electric guitar and doesn’t want to take it to the [Dave] Matthews Bridge, followed by Ambrose climbing on top of the equipment truck on the side of the venue, leading to the line “I’m on the truck!” Her and I (Slow Jam 2), which was last played 2023-06-18 (50 show gap), contained a Slow Jam 1 intro as well as Iron Lung teases.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition - 600
Foil Edition- 200

data.jamchart_notes: Might be the most lowkey electric performance of it ever with an entire Iron Lung jam and a bluesy disco section
data.shownotes: Her and I contained Ice V and Slow Jam 1 teases and Iron Lung teases and quotes. Before Crumbling Castle, Ambrose thanked the crowd and thanked the city for OutKast. Hog Calling Contest and Moby Dick (Led Zeppelin) were teased before Flight b741. Iron Lung contained a Lava intro. Between Sad Pilot and Rats in the Sky, Ambrose shouted out the previous venues the band played in Atlanta, and made an Austin Powers reference. The Garden Goblin was dedicated to cameraman Allen and his partner who requested the song.  Following Gilgamesh Amby quoted Time After Time (Cyndi Lauper).  Set was on the written setlist as the final song but was not played.

Altered Beast I was played for the first time since 2023-06-16 (96 shows), Alter Me I was played for the first time since 2024-05-18 (64 shows), and Altered Beast II was played for the first time since 2024-03-14 (72 shows). Raw Feel contained Am I In Heaven? and Head On/Pill teases. Boogieman Sam featured a guitar/harmonica duel between Joey & Amby and contained teases of Sad Pilot & The Bitter Boogie, a Mirage City jam, Altered Beast II teases and Phantom Island quotes. Chang'e was unfinished. After Hell, Joey introduced the rest of the band, followed by Stu introducing Joey. The audience then chanted "free free Palestine!"; the band encouraged them to "say that shit louder!".
data.soundcheck: Altered Beast Suite, Venusian 1, Predator X, Mirage City

data.jamchart_notes: Multiple sections of extensive jamming between verses, a bit of a Southern Rock flair, and a handful of teases.
data.shownotes: The band dressed in drag for the third annual drag night. Theia, Sad Pilot, Most Of What I Like, and Aerodynamic were performed acoustic. Theia contained The River and The Land Before Timeland teases. Most Of What I Like contained Praise You (Fatboy Slim) teases and was dedicated by Joey to his wife Edith. Aerodynamic was played for the first time without an orchestra. Before Venusian 1, the band said if they should have soundchecked it and joked that if they messed it up, they would play Stoned Mullet instead. Following Venusian 1, Joey quoted Chop Suey (System of a Down) and Lucas shouted out festival act Yvie Oddly. Her and I (Slow Jam 2) contained You Can Be Your Silhouette, Am I In Heaven?, The River, Blindness (The Fall), Crumbling Castle, and Monkey Disco (Babe Rainbow) teases. Following Her and I, the band announced that the festival would be played again next year, and shouted out their manager Michelle Cable and the fans at the festival. O.N.E. was introduced as Duran Duran's favorite song. Before Billabong Valley, Joey mentioned Australian rapper RAED. During The Silver Cord, Stu vamped on the lyrics "let's get fucked up" and "everybody wants to save us." Following Daily Blues, Ambrose quoted Scarface (Push It to the Limit) (Paul Engemann). Float Along - Fill Your Lungs was dedicated to Matt Gawiak, a fan that passed away during the show night 1 of the festival and contained a Dragon jam. Ambrose led the crowd in a chant of 'Matt' following Float Along - Fill Your Lungs. The Dripping Tap was also dedicated to Matt Gawaik. Rats In The sky was on the printed setlist after The Garden Goblin but was skipped.
